Articles.Content:
What can I do? What causes the problem?

Edited August 17, 2015 by 2001kraft
I had null refs and I just ended up creating a new unity project.

That looks heinous.

Have you had any luck narrowing down the problem? Swapping the texture for something else, or trying the texture on another model?
check the part's materials, make sure there're no missing textures.

This exact texture was on my dome. It worked fine.

I think I figured out the problem: the collision box does not have a material because I don't know how to make it not show up. Removing the render mesh component didn't help. I'll apply the default texture unto it, the same way as it was before. Then I'll just need to figure out how to make it stop showing up. Anyone know the problem with thatÃ¢â‚¬â€¹?

For collision meshes in Unity, you are supposed to remove the Mesh Renderer component, and replace it with a Mesh Collider (ideally set to convex).

I suspect that the mesh itself has invalid faces/edges/vertices. You mentioned the collision mesh was for a dome - could you post a screenshot of how you made it?

No, the collision mesh is for a tube, here are a couple screenshots:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Removing the mesh renderer didn't help for some reason.

Also, I mentioned the dome because it used the exact same texture as this model does, someone asked whether or not it was used before.
it looks like you applied the mesh collider to the group. you need to apply it to each of the IDxx meshes that are children to the "group_2"

Hi!

The collision mesh and rendering is now fine, and the error is gone too. I do have a problem:

Textures still refuse to export. No errors, no anything. Just don't show up. :/
Everything works now! I accidentally made a collider for the main mesh lol
